title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 December 2014 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
00:32 <mflorea1> has quit  
04:34 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
04:40 <lucaa> has quit  
08:22 <janepe> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <alex\_ccr> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <gdelhumeau> hi alex\_ccr  
10:32 <gdelhumeau> what do you get when you do:  
10:33 <gdelhumeau> {{velocity}}$xwiki.getDocument($services.model.createDocumentReference('', 'Mon espace', 'ma page avec/un/slash'){{/velocity}}  
10:33 <gdelhumeau> ?  
10:33 <alex\_ccr> Hi gdelhumeau ! I had no result, but I found this trick : http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Clean+slashes+from+document+names  
10:34 <alex\_ccr> And it works ! :)  
10:34 <gdelhumeau> good :)  
10:35 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <alex\_ccr> I found it by chance ! I was looking for a way to clean PDF names when we export pages, and I found the way to clean slashes  :D  
10:37 <alex\_ccr> Now I'm good  :)  
10:48 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
10:56 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <alex\_ccr> I've another question : is it possible to force the download of a PDF export instead of reading it in the browser ?  
11:20 <ClemensR> I am not sure, but I guess one needs to get rid of the "Content-Disposition: inline" header ....  
11:22 <ClemensR> however that is quite hard wired in the ExportAction class, it seems  
11:25 <vmassol> has quit  
11:28 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:11 <janepe> How can i make panel shared on all wikis in farm?  
12:11 <janepe> I try to make navigation more than "possible"  
12:18 <ClemensR> if you edit the XWiki.XWikiPreferenes of the subwikis in the object editor, you can type in a full path to a panel in the main wiki for the left/rigth panels  
12:20 <ClemensR> something like, e.g.   'Panels.Applications,xwiki:Panels.MyGlobalPanel'  
12:21 <janepe> alright, let's try!  
12:30 <janepe> great! is it possible to add it as default to all newly created subwikis?  
12:34 <alex\_ccr> has quit  
12:43 <ClemensR> well, either you could add it to a template wiki, and create your sub-wikis from that template ... or ...  ah, I dont know out of my head if there is a "wiki created event" and how to listen for it ...  
12:44 <janepe> alright. i have to learn this environment step by step.  
12:44 <janepe> it isn't easy to understand what's going on  
12:45 <gdelhumeau> ClemensR: there is one  
12:45 <ClemensR> unless you create a lot of subwikis the effort to write such a listener is much higher than to set the config up for every subwiki manually, but I gus it is much more fun ;)  
12:45 <gdelhumeau> depends if janepe is a developer or not  
12:45 <gdelhumeau> we don't have the same definition of "fun" :)  
12:45 <ClemensR> gdelhumeau: ah, ok, did not find it quickly enough in the docs ...  
12:45 <janepe> I'm kind of beginning  
12:46 <ClemensR> yes, a template wiki might be the simpler solution in any case  
12:46 <gdelhumeau> +1  
12:46 <janepe> I'm learning OO design patterns right now. Strategy, Abstract Factory, Decorator, Observer etc.  
12:47 <janepe> I know few languages but i haven't started writing programs  
12:47 <ClemensR> that is, you create one special subwiki, that is not really used , and set that "This is a template wiki" flag on creation ... then you can adapt stuff there in the XWikiReferences and what else. and use it to create new subwikis  
12:47 <ClemensR> that would be the "zero coding" solution  
12:48 <lucaa> has quit  
12:48 <ClemensR> however if you want to learn programming with XWiki instead ... ah, let me check the docs ...  
12:48 <janepe> i'm not going to be illiterate however right now i have problem with setting these preferences manually, so step by step is good solution  
12:49 <ClemensR> you could play with the  event listener tutorial : http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingEventListenerTutorial   if you want an "automatic" solution  
12:50 <ClemensR> however I would consider this a "training exercise" ... normally setting this stuff up once in a template wiki and then use that template wiki to create more wikis is the way to go  
12:56 <janepe> ClemensR, this is crazy. I'm editing XWiki.XWikiPreferences in /xwiki/wiki/MySubwiki/edit/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=object but changes aren't applied. Itsn't working  
12:57 <ClemensR> hm, did you try with "save & continue" ?  you might see an ajax-request going out and can debug that with developer tools  
12:57 <janepe> it's saved  
12:59 <janepe> i mean, i can refresh and see the change in object settings. however this doesn't reflect menus  
12:59 <ClemensR> ah, too bad, I thought it would. Maybe something with view permissions? if the Panel in the mail wiki is not viewable by anonymous users, it might not be visible in the subwiki, either  
13:00 <janepe> It haven't worked in main wiki too  
13:00 <janepe> i've set it on main wiki with "panel wizard"  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> janepe: Your use-case cannot work with the panel wizard  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> you need to go to Admin > Presentation  
13:07 <octo> has quit  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> then you will have 2 inputs "leftPanels" and "rightPanels"  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> do you see them?  
13:09 <gdelhumeau> in these fields, you can enter the list of panels that you want to display, separated by commas  
13:09 <gdelhumeau> here, you can put xwiki:Panels.NameOfYourPanel  
13:09 <gdelhumeau> the "xwiki:" prefix means "take it from the main wiki"  
13:10 <janepe> there is nothing like that in "Administration: Presentation" http://i.imgur.com/CE6iNvY.png; there is XWiki.XWikiPreferences object which i'm editing using ?editor=object  
13:10 <gdelhumeau> the panel wizard is just here to help you to fill these 2 fields, but it does not handle the panels from other wikis, that is why you cannot use it for this use-case  
13:11 <ClemensR> gdelhumeau: Panels input no longer there in the "Presentation" menu in 6.3 (at least in my snapshot), that is why I asked to use the object editor instead  
13:11 <janepe> but as i can see they have default values again. so maybe there is something wrong with saving  
13:11 <gdelhumeau> sorry  
13:11 <gdelhumeau> it's on "Page Elements"
